text: Sagi Rama Krishnam Raju Engineering College is an autonomous institution affiliated to JNTUK, Kakinada, approved by AICTE and accredited by NAAC. The academic regulations govern undergraduate and postgraduate programmes offered by the institution.

Sagi Rama Krishnam Raju Engineering College is an autonomous institution affiliated to JNTUK, Kakinada, approved by AICTE and accredited by NAAC with A+ grade. These regulations apply to B.Tech students admitted from the academic year 2023-24 onwards.
R23 academic regulations apply to B.Tech students admitted from the academic year 2023–24 onwards.

The B.Tech regular programme shall be completed in four academic years and shall not exceed eight academic years. Students availing the gap year facility may extend the duration by up to two additional years.
A student must register for and successfully secure a total of 160 credits to be eligible for the award of the B.Tech degree.
B.Tech with Honors or B.Tech with Minor shall be awarded if a student earns 18 additional credits beyond the regular programme requirements. Registration for Honors or Minors is optional.

Students must maintain at least 40 percent attendance in each course and 75 percent attendance in aggregate to be eligible for semester end examinations. Attendance below 65 percent shall not be condoned.
Theory courses are evaluated for 100 marks, consisting of 30 marks for Continuous Internal Evaluation and 70 marks for the Semester End Examination.
The institution follows a 10-point absolute grading system ranging from S grade for 90 percent and above to F grade for marks below 40. Absent students receive Ab grade.
Students must complete two mandatory summer internships of eight weeks each after second and third years, followed by a full semester internship with project work in the final semester.
R20 academic regulations apply to B.Tech students admitted from the academic year 2020–21 onwards.
The B.Tech programme under R20 regulations consists of four academic years divided into eight semesters, with each semester having a minimum of 90 instruction days.
A student must maintain a minimum of 75 percent attendance in aggregate to be eligible for semester end examinations. Attendance below 65 percent shall not be condoned.
A student must successfully complete 160 credits to be eligible for the award of the B.Tech degree under R20 regulations.
R19 academic regulations apply to B.Tech students admitted from the academic year 2019–20 onwards.
The B.Tech programme under R19 shall be completed in four academic years and shall not exceed eight academic years from the date of admission.
A student must register for and successfully secure a total of 160 credits to be eligible for the award of the B.Tech degree under R19 regulations.
A student must maintain a minimum of 75 percent aggregate attendance to be eligible for semester end examinations. Attendance below 65 percent shall not be condoned.
Each theory course is evaluated for 100 marks comprising internal assessment and end semester examination as per institutional evaluation norms.
Promotion to higher semesters requires satisfying attendance criteria and securing the prescribed minimum percentage of credits in completed semesters.
R17 academic regulations apply to B.Tech students admitted from the academic year 2017–18 onwards.
The B.Tech programme under R17 shall be completed in not less than four and not more than eight academic years from the date of admission.
A student must register for and successfully secure a total of 180 credits to be eligible for the award of the B.Tech degree under R17 regulations.
Theory courses are evaluated for 100 marks with 30 marks for internal assessment and 70 marks for end semester examination. Project work is evaluated for 200 marks.
Students may apply for revaluation of theory course answer scripts as per notifications issued by the Controller of Examinations.
To be eligible for the award of the M.Tech degree under R19 regulations, a student must register for and secure a total of 68 credits within the prescribed duration.
The M.Tech programme under R17 regulations shall be completed in not less than two and not more than four academic years.
To be awarded a B.Tech Minor degree under R23 regulations, a student must earn an additional 18 credits beyond the regular B.Tech programme.
Students are not permitted to pursue a Minor in the same department as their major discipline and cannot pursue both Honors and Minors simultaneously.
Students with a CGPA of 7.75 or above and without any supplementary appearance are eligible to register for the B.Tech Minor programme under R20 regulations.
Students with a CGPA of 8.00 or above and without any supplementary appearance are eligible to register for the B.Tech Honors programme under R20 regulations.
As per amendment, students are not required to maintain a CGPA of 7.75 in Minor programme courses, provided they pass all minor courses without supplementary appearance.
As per amendment, students are not required to maintain a CGPA of 8.00 in Honors programme courses, provided they pass all honors courses without supplementary appearance.
The BBA programme academic regulations apply to undergraduate students admitted to the Bachelor of Business Administration programme as prescribed by the institution.
The duration of the BBA programme is three academic years divided into six semesters as per institutional norms.
BBA courses are evaluated through continuous internal assessment and semester end examinations following the academic evaluation framework of the institution.
The medium of instruction for all programmes, including examinations and project reports, shall be English only.

Any form of examination malpractice including copying, impersonation, possession of prohibited materials, or misconduct shall result in cancellation of performance, debarment, or forfeiture of seat as per institutional rules.
